channel.title: Master YongHua's American Mahayana Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Master YongHua
channel.description:
A re-broadcast of Master YongHua's live Dharma talks and sutra lectures streamed live on his YouTube Channel. Join us live and submit questions in chat as a part of our growing international community of cultivators:
https://youtube.com/@MasterYongHua
American Mahayana Buddhism is fundamentally Chinese Mahayana reinterpreted for the american culture and sensibilities, founded by Dharma Master YongHua
Master YongHua was born in South Vietnam and came to the United States in 1973 to attend college. He earned a B.S. degree in Mathematics from the University of Minnesota and an M.B.A. degree from the University of Chicago.
After working in the corporate world for decades, he decided to leave the home life to study Chan under Great Master XuanHua, Tuyen Hoa, in 1995. In 1999, he became fully ordained under Master Man Giac. He then went to Taiwan to study Chinese and the Vinaya (the Buddhist rules of morality) for 2 years. He returned to the United States in 2001 and practiced in seclusion until 2005, at which time he began teaching Chan and accepting disciples.
Master YongHua has been offering free programs and retreats for over 15 years. In 2012, Master YongHua founded Lu Mountain Temple, in Rosemead, California. In 2018, his operations were moved to a new facility – Wei Mountain Temple – also located in Rosemead, California. Wei Mountain Temple currently offers Chan meditation programs every Saturday and Buddhist Dharma assemblies every Sunday. Master YongHua also lectures on the Mahayana Sutras every weekend.
